Please contact kirsty.morrin@postgrad.manchester.ac.uk for further information<br><br>Re-appropriating Value(s) in Higher Education<br><br>25th June 2015, The University of Manchester<br><br>Keynote Speakers: Dr. Stephanie Lawler (University of York)<br>Prof. Tracy Shildrick (The University of Leeds)<br>Prof. Robert MacDonald (Teeside University) [...] Kristoffer Halvorsrud 2015-02-15T15:50:41+00:00 2015-02-15T15:50:41+00:00 Free Place at BSA Citizenship Study Group Event https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-BOURDIEU-STUDY-GROUP;d9c68ac3.1502 Free Place at BSA Citizenship Study Group Event<br><br>A couple of delegates are unable to make the forthcoming BSA Citizenship Study Group Launch Event: Citizenship in the European Union on Monday 16th of February at the BSA Meeting Room, London. They have asked if their ticket could be given free of charge to someone else interested in the topic. Participants include: Mike Savage, Daniel Laurison, Michael McQuarrie (all LSE Sociology), Martin Loughlin, Insa Koch, Andrew Lang (all LSE Law), and Matthew Eagleton-Pierce (SOAS). All are welcome to attend, but places [...] Jenny Thatcher 2015-02-10T19:28:59+00:00 2015-02-10T19:28:59+00:00 Colloquium on Bourdieusian field methods and theories https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-BOURDIEU-STUDY-GROUP;59f97e51.1502 The below event may be of interest to international members on this list.<br><br>Professor Michael Grenfell has ask if study group could circulate details of this event to its members.<br><br>This free event, sponsored by the University of Newcastle and the University of Technology Sydney, will include keynote addresses by leading international and national Bourdieusian scholars about the theory and methods of field analysis in research in education, journalism, cultural studies and law. Please circulate this information widely to your academic networks and to anyone who might be interested in this event. [...] Jenny Thatcher 2015-01-21T11:54:19+00:00 2015-01-21T11:54:19+00:00 Call for papers: Bourdieu's methodology https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-BOURDIEU-STUDY-GROUP;be32bed7.1501 Dear All,<br><br>The below call for papers may be of interest to members.<br><br>Call for Papers<br><br>Empirical Investigation of Social Space II<br><br>The objective of this international conference is to bring together social scientists interested in<br>both traditional and modern methods for the construction of social space, in line with the<br>work of Pierre Bourdieu. This event follows the spirit of a conference organized by Henry<br>Rouanet (1931-2008), Brigitte Le Roux, and J\ufffd\ufffdrg Blasius with Bourdieu\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds participation, in<br>Cologne, Germany, in 1998. References to these can now be found on our blog: https://bsabourdieu.wordpress.com/2014/12/23/new-and-past-publications-by-study-group-members/ Upon the blog post yesterday we received several hundred hits from over 25 countries, as far away as Indonesia and New Zealand. The selected publication page has also been updated to include these new references: https://bsabourdieu.wordpress.com/selected-publications/ [...] S. Submissions<br>from advanced PhD students are also welcome. I will be updating the study group\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds publications by member\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds page: http://bsabourdieu.wordpress.com/selected-publications/<br><br>Sending Details<br><br>I would ask that members send their publication details using the Harvard referencing system, provide an electronic link to where people can view/access/buy your publication, and entitle the email: Publications by Study Group Members. Please send it to bourdieu2011@gmail.com<br>Our study group blogs receive several hundreds of hits upon a [...] Jenny Thatcher 2014-11-20T15:49:20+00:00 2014-11-20T15:49:20+00:00 Only two places left: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOn the Street Where you Live\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Bourdieusian analysis of socio-spatial hierarchy. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-BOURDIEU-STUDY-GROUP;9c332c19.1411 Dear All,<br><br>As of yesterday there were only two places left on the Bourdieu study group\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds forthcoming event: 'On the Street Where you Live': Bourdieusian analysis of socio-spatial hierarchy 2 December 2014, London.<br><br>To register, please go to the BSA website: http://www.britsoc.co.uk/events/key-bsa-events.aspx<br><br>Please note that once this event is fully booked we will not be able to fit anymore delegates in due to the limited number of available seats. So if you would like to come I recommend booking ASAP. [...] Jenny Thatcher 2014-11-10T12:37:26+00:00 2014-11-10T12:37:26+00:00 Nearly fully booked: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOn the Street Where you Live\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Bourdieusian analysis of socio-spatial hierarchy. https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-BOURDIEU-STUDY-GROUP;2a350aa8.1411 Dear All,<br><br>Just to let you know, there are only a handful of places left for the Bourdieu study group\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds next event: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOn the Street Where you Live\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Bourdieusian analysis of socio-spatial hierarchy.<br><br>To book your place, please go to the BSA events page: http://www.britsoc.co.uk/events/key-bsa-events.aspx.<br><br>Best wishes, Jenny Jenny Thatcher 2014-11-03T10:44:23+00:00 2014-11-03T10:44:23+00:00 Book: Cultural Relativism and International Politics https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-BOURDIEU-STUDY-GROUP;939f8c8d.1411 Dear All,<br><br>Thank you for all of those that are sending us your publication details. We will be updating the page at the end of November.<br><br>On the topic of discounted books, Prof Derek Robbins is to release his latest book just before Christmas: Cultural Relativism and International Politics.<br>The book looks through historical studies of some of the work of Montesquieu, Comte, Durkheim, Boas, Morgenthau, Aron and Bourdieu. Robbins develops further the ideas of Bourdieu. He argues that we need to integrate the recognition of cultural difference with the practice of international politics by accepting that the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdfield\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd of [...] Jenny Thatcher 2014-11-03T10:20:55+00:00 2014-11-03T10:20:55+00:00 Event: Comedy and Distinction: The Cultural Currency of a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGood\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Sense of Humour https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-BOURDIEU-STUDY-GROUP;1d1b03d5.1411 Dear All,<br><br>Study group member Dr Sam Friedman will be launching his book next Wednesday 12TH November: Comedy and Distinction: The Cultural Currency of a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGood\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Sense of Humour from 6.30pm at the LSE.<br><br>Speakers will include: Lydia Hampson, Brian Logan and Professor Mike Savage. Professor Mike Savage will discuss the role of comedy taste as a form of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdemerging cultural capital\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Brian Logan will reflect on the role of critics as comedy tastemakers and freelance comedy agent Lydia Hampson will offer reflections on her work as a comedy scout. [...] Jenny Thatcher 2014-10-25T12:24:10+01:00 2014-10-25T12:24:10+01:00 Publications by members https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-BOURDIEU-STUDY-GROUP;e382953e.1410 Dear All,<br><br>I will be updating the study group\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds publications by member\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds page at the end of November: http://bsabourdieu.wordpress.com/selected-publications/<br><br>I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdm aware that some members have contacted various co-convenors since the last publication list was updated. It\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds very difficult for us to keep track of these emails and do not always have the time to update the page after each email. As such, we have a specific call for members publications related to Bourdieu every few months, so that the page can be updated in one go and we do not miss anyone out. If you have sent details of publications [...] Jenny Thatcher 2014-09-30T17:44:52+01:00 2014-09-30T17:44:52+01:00 Booking now open: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOn the Street Where you Live\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Bourdieusian analysis of socio-spatial hierarchy https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-BOURDIEU-STUDY-GROUP;4996780a.1409 Dear All,<br><br>Apologies, JISCMAIL automatically filled out the subject title to the last email I sent on this list in which it stated: Booking now open: Bourdieu in migration and \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdrace\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd/ethnicity studies. Of course I meant the booking is now open to our next event: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOn the Street Where you Live\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd: Bourdieusian analysis of socio-spatial hierarchy. All details on the event can be found on our blog: http://bsabourdieu.wordpress.com/2014/07/05/on-the-street-where-you-live-bourdieusian-analysis-of-socio-spatial-hierarchy/. You can register for the event on the BSA event site: http://www.britsoc.co.uk/events/key-bsa-events.aspx<br><br>We are pleased to announce an additional presentation by Dr Simon Harding (Middlesex University) on London Street Gangs using Bourdieu.<br>Please note that this event has received many enquiries and is therefore likely to be booked-up quickly. Due to room facilities there will be a strict limit on available places. Due to room facilities there will be a strict limit on available places. [...] Manfred Isaac 2014-09-11T14:48:14+01:00 2014-09-11T14:48:14+01:00 Interdisciplinary Call. Housing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd A Critical Perspective https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-BOURDIEU-STUDY-GROUP;3dc96b4a.1409 Hi all. This may be of interest. I know they\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre interested in linking with Bourdieuian ideas around living in cities.<br>Together with the Sociology Department of Liverpool University and the Architecture Department of Liverpool John Moores University, Architecture_MPS is organising a two day interdisciplinary conference on the theme of affordable housing provision. Forming part of a broader program of international events, Housing \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Critical Futures, it is open to activists, artists and academics of all disciplines. It is set in the UK but seeks to link with global issues. On behalf of the CSWG organising<br>committee, I would be grateful if you could circulate the attached call for<br>abstracts to all staff and postgraduate students (both taught and<br>research). The deadline for submission is Friday 31st October. Do you know of a English translation of the below article by Bourdieu?<br><br>Le capital social: In: Actes de la recherche en sciences sociales. Vol. 31, janvier 1980. Le capital social. pp. 2-3.<br>If you do, please email Jessie at: AbrahamsJJ@cardiff.ac.uk . (http://www.britsoc.co.uk/events/bsa-annual-conference.aspx). The conference will take place at the Glasgow Caledonian University from 15-17 April 2015. The booking portal will close at midnight on Sunday. [...] Jessie Abrahams 2014-07-01T11:54:00+01:00 2014-07-01T11:54:00+01:00 Next Study Group Event: Last Chance to Book https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-BOURDIEU-STUDY-GROUP;2b6755ee.1407 Dear All<br><br>In case anyone has been meaning to book onto this event and forgotten or just missed the info about it, Professor Diane Reay and Dr Vikki Boliver, are coming to Cardiff on 8th July for our next Bourdieu study group event 'Are Elite Universities Meritocratic?' They will also be joined by Professor David James, Professor Harriet Bradley and Mr Richard Smith from HEFCE to have a debate about this issue. For more info: http://www.britsoc.co.uk/media/65353/Bourdieu_Are_Elite_Universities_Meritocratic_080714.pdf?1404215571893 [...]
